section.title: hconfiguration of sales module Configure Sales
section.para: To configure the Sales module, select the "Configure Sales" option. The following screen will appear:
When configuring the S/O module, you are presented with the following options:

varlistentry.term: sales orders numbering of Sales Order # Generation

listitem.para: Select one of the available Sales Order Number generation methods:
Sales Order Numbers will be automatically incremented by 1 each time a new Sales Order is created. These automatically-generated numbers may not be edited. They are read-only.
Sales Order Numbers must be entered manually whenever you create a new Sales Order.

Sales Order Numbers will be automatically generated and incremented, as under the "Automatic" option described above. However, this option also allows you to manually override the Sales Order Number at the time of Sales Order creation.

The next sequentially available Sales Order Number will display here. You may change the number--creating a new basis for the next Sales Order Number--by typing the new number into this field. Any changes you make here will be reflected the next time a new Sales Order is created in the S/O module.
Select one of the available Quote Number generation methods:
Quote Numbers must be entered manually whenever you create a new Quote.
Quote Numbers will be automatically incremented by 1 each time a new Quote is created. These automatically-generated numbers may not be edited. They are read-only.

Quote Numbers will be automatically generated and incremented, as under the "Automatic" option described above. However, this option also allows you to manually override the Quote Number at the time of Quote creation.

Quote Numbers will be automatically incremented by 1 each time a new Quote is created, using the same number generation method specified for the creation of Sales Order Numbers. These automatically-generated numbers may not be edited. They are read-only.

The next sequentially available Quote Number will display here. You may change the number--creating a new basis for the next Quote Number--by typing the new number into this field. Any changes you make here will be reflected the next time a new Quote is created in the S/O module.

varlistentry.term: credit memos numbering of Credit Memo # Generation

listitem.para: Select one of the available Credit Memo Number generation methods:
Credit Memo Numbers must be entered manually whenever you create a new Credit Memo.
Credit Memo Numbers will be automatically incremented by 1 each time you issue a new Credit Memo. These automatically-generated numbers may not be edited. They are read-only.

Credit Memo Numbers will be automatically generated and incremented, as under the "Automatic" option described above. However, this option also allows you to manually override the Credit Memo Number at the time of Credit Memo creation.

Credit Memo Numbers will be automatically incremented by 1 each time a new Credit Memo is created, using the same number generation method specified for the creation of Sales Order Numbers. These automatically-generated numbers may not be edited. They are read-only.

The next sequentially available Credit Memo Number will display here. You may change the number--creating a new basis for the next Credit Memo Number--by typing the new number into this field. Any changes you make here will be reflected the next time you issue a new Credit Memo within the S/O module.
By default, Invoice Numbers are automatically generated. This system setting cannot be changed.

The next sequentially available Invoice Number will display here. You may change the number--creating a new basis for the next Invoice Number--by typing the new number into this field. Any changes you make here will be reflected the next time you create a new Invoice within the S/O module.

section.para: To establish general settings for the S/O module, select the "General" tab. The following options will appear:

varlistentry.term: sales orders discount defaults for Allow Price Discounts

listitem.para: Check this option to allow pricing discounts for select customers. This option instructs the system to verify whether any Pricing Discounts have been established for a Customer, prior to calculating the Line Item Price for of an Item within a Sales Order. If this option is unchecked, then the system will apply the full List Price for an Item within a Sales Order.
Selecting this option will cause Sales Order Line Items to become immediately past due if no schedule date is entered.

varlistentry.term: Post Customer Changes to the Change Log

listitem.para: Select to post to the Change Log any changes made to Customer masters.

varlistentry.term: Post Sales Order Changes to the Change Log

listitem.para: Select to post to the Change Log any changes made to Sales Orders.

varlistentry.term: Restrict Credit Memos to Items that appear on their Apply-To Document

listitem.para: Select if you want to restrict Credit Memo Items to their Apply-To Document. Selecting this option narrows the Credit Memo Item selection process to only those Items which appeared on the Invoice the Credit Memo is being applied to. If not selected, a sold Item master list will appear instead when selecting Credit Memo Items for Credit Memos applied to a specific Invoice. This setting has no bearing on unapplied Credit Memos.

varlistentry.term: Automatically check "Select for Billing" option on Ship Order screen

listitem.para: Select if you want the "Select for Billing" option to be selected by default whenever you ship Sales Order Line Items. Selecting this option reduces steps in the billing process. Specifically, if an Order is selected for billing when it is shipped, you do not then have to take the extra step of independently selecting the Order for billing. This can save time and also ensure your shipped Orders are selected for billing at the time of shipment.

varlistentry.term: Always show "Save and Add to Packing List" button on Sales Order screen

listitem.para: Select if you want the SAVE AND ADD TO PACKING LIST button to always be displayed on the Sales Order header screen. If this option is not selected, the SAVE AND ADD TO PACKING LIST button will only be displayed for newly-entered Sales Orders which have not yet been saved.

varlistentry.term: Disallow Override of Sales Price on Sales Order Entry

listitem.para: Select to prevent all users from overriding the Sales Price when entering Sales Order Line Items. This is a system-wide setting, affecting all users. Do not select this option if you want to selectively prevent users from overriding Sales Prices. Individual users may be granted the ability to override Sales Prices, use the S/O module's OverridePrice privilege.

varlistentry.term: Automatically Allocate Credit Memos to New Sales Order on Save

listitem.para: Select to have open Credit Memos for a Customer automatically allocated to any new Sales Orders entered for that Customer. This functionality helps reduce Customer credit balances by ensuring that Customer credits are consumed when new Sales Orders are entered. Any available, open Credit Memos are eligible for allocation. The allocation of available Credit Memos occurs only once--when a Sales Order is saved for the first time. Subsequent saves will not result in additional allocations. Credit Memos which have been allocated to a Sales Order are applied at the point when the Invoice resulting from the Sales Order is posted. Once the full balance of a Credit Memo has been applied, the Credit Memo is then closed. The printed Invoice the Customer receives will indicate whether Credit Memos have been applied. In addition, the total due from the Customer will be automatically adjusted to reflect any applied credits.

note.para: The allocation of available Credit Memos occurs only once--when a Sales Order is saved for the first time. Subsequent saves will not result in additional allocations.

varlistentry.term: Hide Misc. Charges on Sales Order screen

listitem.para: Select to hide all fields related to Miscellaneous Charges on the Sales Order Line Item tab. If your site does not use Misc. Charges when entering Sales Orders, it may make sense to hide this functionality to avoid confusion.

varlistentry.term: Enable Shipping interface from Sales Order screen

listitem.para: Select to enable the performance of limited Shipping functionality from the Sales Order header. If selected, users will be able to issue Stock to Shipping and also return Stock from Shipping directly from the Sales Order header. If not selected, these Shipping options will not be available on the Sales Order header.

varlistentry.term: Check Print S/O on Save by Default

listitem.para: Select to prompt users to print Sales Orders whenever Sales Orders are saved.
If selected, users will be presented with a Sales Order print screen whenever a Sales Order is saved. To bypass this feature, do not select this option.
Select one of the following as your preferred response when users change Sales Order Line Item quantity on EDIT:

varlistentry.term: Update Price on Line Item Edit

listitem.para: If selected, the system will automatically update the Net Unit Price for the Line Item, adjusting to accommodate the newly-entered quantity.

If selected, the system will ask users if they want to update the Net Unit Price (YES/NO). If they answer "YES" because they do want to update the Price, then they will have to manually make the Price adjustment.

varlistentry.term: Do not Update Price on Line Edit

listitem.para: If selected, the Net Unit Price will not be changed when Line Item quantity is changed on EDIT--and users will not be prompted to consider changing the Price.

note.para: The Sales Order Line Item pricing options apply only when editing Line Item quantity.

section.para: To establish default settings to be used whenever new Customers are entered, select the "Customer Defaults" tab. The following screen will appear:
When establishing Customer master default settings, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify a default Shipping Form.
Specify a default Ship Via.
Specify a default procedure for handling cash receipts from Customers. This notation is informational only. Balance Forward: Select to apply cash receipts to the Customer's current balance due.
Specify a default Customer Type to be used whenever new Customers are created. The default Customer Type may be overridden by users having the appropriate privileges.
Specify the default credit limit to be used for all Customers.
Specify the default credit rating to be used for all Customers.
Select to indicate Customers accept partial shipments by default.
Select to indicate Customers accept backorders by default.
Select to indicate Customers allow free-form Ship-Tos by default. This default appears on the Customer master.
